caption: Figure 8: (a): Visualization of ∂Gk/∂x in arrows, which is proportional to ∇pᵢ. (b) The splats are biased towards adjusting its scale parameters rather than splitting along the longer axis, converging into a needle-like Gaussians.
description: This figure shows the visualization of the gradient of a 2D Gaussian and the effect of the gradient on the splitting of Gaussians. In (a), the gradient is visualized with arrows, showing that the gradient is proportional to the pixel gradient. In (b), it is shown that the splats are biased towards adjusting their scale parameters rather than splitting along the longer axis, resulting in needle-like Gaussians. This phenomenon is due to the fact that the gradient along the longer axis is typically small, so the splats are not effectively densified along the longer axis.
